trans-unit.source: This binding element can be used to enable [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] applications to send messages to and receive messages from existing MSMQ applications that use either COM, MSMQ native APIs, or the APIs in <xref href="System.Messaging"></xref>.
Use this class to send and receive messages from MSMQ-based messaging applications.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBindingElement"></xref> class.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Returns a clone of the binding element.
A clone of the binding element.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets a <xref:System.String> that contains the scheme used by the binding element.
This property returns the string "msmq.formatname" to indicate the addressing scheme used by the MSMQ integration channel.
For more information about queue addressing, see [Service Endpoints and Queue Addressing](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The <xref:System.String> that contains the scheme used by the binding element.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat"></xref> to be used when serializing MSMQ messages.
This property can have one of the following values: - `ActiveX` - The ActiveX serializer is used to serialize objects.
- `Binary` - The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter> is used to serialize objects.
- `ByteArray` - The object is serialized to an array of bytes.
- `Stream` - The object is serialized to a stream.
- `Xml` - The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> is used to serialize objects.
- The default value is `Xml`.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat"></xref> to be used when serializing MSMQ messages.
The value is not within the values of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat"></xref>.
Gets or sets an array of <xref:System.Type> objects that contain the types to which messages should be deserialized.
The body of an MSMQ message is not typed.

The TargetSerializationTypes property enables you to specify the types to which messages are deserialized when they are sent from an MSMQ application to a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] receiving application.
This property is used only if <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat> is set to `Xml`.
An array of <xref:System.Type> that contains the types to which messages should be deserialized.
